intro: Polycarpon longiflorum, commonly known as the long-flowered sandwort, is a flowering plant native to Europe and parts of Asia. It belongs to the family Caryophyllaceae and is characterized by its slender, upright stems and clusters of small, white or pinkish flowers. The plant typically grows in dry, sandy or rocky soils and is often found in open habitats such as grasslands and coastal areas. It produces small, capsule-like fruits that contain several seeds, which are dispersed by wind. Polycarpon longiflorum is a perennial species that is relatively easy to cultivate in well-drained soils.
